description: System-generated unique identifier for the unit of measure record, serving as the primary key and join reference across tables.
Row version timestamp capturing when the record was created or last updated, with millisecond-level precision, used for auditing, change detection, and synchronization.
Business-friendly name of the measurement unit used throughout the system for quantities, inventory, purchasing, and reporting.
Identifier from a prior or external source system linking this record to its original entry; likely used for migration mapping and reconciliation; confirm with SME.
Name of the source table in the legacy system associated with the legacy identifier; likely retained for lineage, traceability, and troubleshooting; confirm with SME.
Singular form of the unit label for grammatically correct display when quantity equals one; likely derived from the main unit name; confirm with SME.
